episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including a park ranger's repeated lightning strikes, a cat winning a dog award, ancient parking penalties, and the unique mating habits of insects.

facts.fact: The seventh time Park Ranger Roy Sullivan was struck by lightning coincided with the 22nd time he fought off a bear with a stick.
This year, America's Hero Dog of the Year award was won by a cat.
The earliest known penalty for illegal parking was to be impaled on a stake.
Female corn earworm moths go invisible after sex.
